TopicTitle: Best way to move your Kerbals on other bodies?

Articles.Content: So far, Ive only visited Duna, after finally developing a good lander. Ive also found that our favorite green men are very slow to move around on Duna, due to its gravity. Ive adopted a sorta EVA-pack glide, followed by a face-first slide on impact. However ungraceful, its faster than jogging around. How do you guys do it, on Duna or otherwise?

I use your way, but it uses EVA fuel, which you can't get back unless you get back inside your pod.

I came to use rovers (cart mod) but sometimes it's weight is costly

I discovered, however, that if you press alt + > or < you increase or dicrease the new physics warp. If you that while running (shift, if you don't know) you can run 4x faster.
I had no idea about the shift, thanks! Id use rovers, but that would mean id have to get them to Duna.. Easier said than done. Anyway, thanks for the tip

If the gravity is high enough, you can hold down the shift key to make the little guy run. I'm not sure what the cut off gravity is, but you can run on Duna, but not Mun, Minmus, or Ike. I think you can run on Eve, but I'm not sure. I haven't landed anywhere else yet.

I like to use my "Halo Reach Zombie Run": Sprint like heck up the side of a hill, then jump off the top. Don't worry about sticking the landing: you can't kill them this way. (Believe me, Jeb has tried. )
I tried the 4x running on Eve and Bill exploded while running...
